column3: rebased on top of #5371. Both depend on #5370.\n
Sounds great to have. Now it has me wondering, though, if the same is possible for Windows signing?\n

@Michagogo I'm not sure, as I haven't researched win32 signed binaries. This was especially easy for osx, since (nearly) the only change to the binary is a small sig insertion near the end. If win32 is the same, it's likely doable there as well. There may even be existing tools we could use. Worth looking into.\n
